Type.Name: NetworkCredential

TypeSignature.Value: .class public NetworkCredential extends System.Object implements System.Net.ICredentials
.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit NetworkCredential extends System.Object implements class System.Net.ICredentials, class System.Net.ICredentialsByHost

Type.ThreadingSafetyStatement: All public static members of this type are safe for multithreaded operations. No instance members are guaranteed to be thread safe.

remarks.para: The class is a base class that supplies credentials in password-based authentication schemes such as basic, digest, NTLM, and Kerberos. Classes that implement the interface, such as the class, return objects.
This class does not support public key-based authentication methods such as Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) client authentication.

summary.para: Provides credentials for password-based authentication schemes such as basic, digest, NTLM, and Kerberos authentication.

MemberSignature.Value: .property string Domain { public hidebysig specialname instance string get_Domain() public hidebysig specialname instance void set_Domain(string value) }
public string Domain { get; set; }
.property instance string Domain

value.para: A containing the name of the domain that verifies the current credentials.

Docs.permission: Requires read access to the environment variable that contains the domain name. See .

remarks.para: The property specifies the domain or realm to which the user name belongs. Typically, this is the host computer name where the application runs or the user domain for the currently logged in user.

summary.para: Gets or sets the domain or computer name that verifies the credentials.

summary.para: Returns an instance of the class for the specified Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) and authentication type.

Docs.param: The URI that the client provides authentication for.
The type of authentication requested, as defined in the property.

remarks.para: The value of corresponds to the property.

summary.para: Returns an instance of the class for the specified host, port, and authentication type.

returns.para: A for the specified host, port, and authentication protocol, or null if there are no credentials available for the specified host, port, and authentication protocol.

Docs.param: The host computer that authenticates the client.
The port on the that the client communicates with.
